metadata.title: CVE-2022-40898 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue discovered in Python Packaging Authority (PyPA) Wheel 0.37.1 andearlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via attackercontrolled input to wheel cli.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-wheel - 0.29.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-wheel-common - 0.29.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-wheel - 0.29.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm4
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm4
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wheel package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.29.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
python-pip package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm4').
